item.name: Repolyo
item.vernacular: CHINESE: Lan cai, Juan xin cai, Ye cai.||DANISH: Hovedkål.||DUTCH: Sluitkool, Sluitkoolachtigen.||ESTONIAN: Peakapsas.||FINNISH: Keräkaali.||FRENCH: Chou cabus, Chou pommé, Chou cultivé, Chou cultivé pommé, Chou blanc, Chou commun.||HINDI: Band gobhii.||ITALIAN: Cavolo cappuccio.||JAPANESE: Kanran, Kyabetsu.||POLISH: Kapusta warzywna gowiasta.||PORTUGUESE: Couve de repolho, Couve de cabeça.||RUSSIAN: Kapusta belokachannaia.||SPANISH: Col, Cogolo, Repollo, Berza común.||URDU: Band gobhii.
item.properties: Repolyo is the head-bearing or true cabbage, a biennial herb. Main axis is short and thick, the leaves are densely packed, and as it grows, close and develop into a gigantic bud of head. There are various forms of cabbage shapes: flat, round, egg-shaped, oval, or conical. Leaves vary in color, from the common light yellowish green to dark green and dark red.
item.usage: Juice of red cabbage used for chronic coughs, bronchitis, asthma.||Juice of white cabbage used to treat warts.||Bruised leaves of the common white cabbage used for blisters.||In European folk medicine, leaves are used for acute inflammation, the paste of raw cabbage are placed on a cabbage leaf and applied to the affected area.||Cabbage juice used to accelerate gastric ulcer healing.
